Review.Titre: Terrible experience with auto-renewal
Review.Contenu: Terrible experience with auto-renewal. 24/7 online chat does not work, and no e-mail is provided. Managed to contact them via Google chat somehow - 8 days after auto-renewal. And now they are not giving me back the refund due to the 3 days late (while I was even lucky to find an address on which I could make the claim). Personally opinion -  a really stupid way to break loyalty and acquire bad word of mouth.

Review.Titre: GoDaddy stole a domain and resold it…And corrupted our client database when moving it (unauthorized both)
Review.Contenu: GoDaddy stole a domain and resold it through their company Afternic, a domain we NEVER put up for sale nor approved the sale, and they essentially stole it right out from under our account and resold it, then took around 25 - 30% commission. In addition, they totally botched a back-end website database transfer, did not follow our instructions or call us back once we got disconnected, and then acted like they did nothing wrong when delivering to us a corrupted SQL database whereby we lost about 60% of our client info.GoDaddy has gone to crap and just does not give a damn about their customers.We are sick of years of over-charging from GoDaddy and moving everything over to Blue Host, a much more affordable and reliable hosting provider.

Review.Titre: Shady business practices
Review.Contenu: I forgot to renew a domain and admitted to GoDaddy it was my error. Whois indicates the domain is still registered with GoDaddy and I then spoke to GoDaddy and asked when it would be become available again. They’ve refused to tell me when it’s back on the market instead trying to sell me a costly backorder service that will allow me to track it and then bid for it? It’s absurd to me they can’t tell me a date, the domain is registered to them. The domain is very bespoke and is not likely to be of interest to anyone. Just allow me to pay for it or renew it, or at least just tell me when it’s back on the market. Shady business practices like this are really disappointing. Running a business is expensive enough without other business trying to extort money from you.

Review.Titre: Horrible.

Today they have registered / parked the domain and want a ridiculously inflated fee for it.Any company operating this way should not be trusted with your online services or business.Wanting money for nothing... Disgusting behaviour and adding nothing of value into the market operating like this.I will never use or recommend their services to anyone now. They are quite clearly unethical.Thankfully there are numerous domain extensions available meaning I can register the name that way.

Review.Titre: Disappointing Experience with GoDaddy’s Handling of My Premium Domains
Review.Contenu: As a loyal GoDaddy customer since 2007, I am deeply disheartened by the recent handling of my account. On December 15, 2023, at 7:55 PM CST, I was notified that three of my .io premium domains were removed from my account. These were part of a group of twelve domains that I have consistently bulk-renewed for the past three years. Strangely, this year, only four were auto-renewed individually, leaving the other eight, including the premium ones, unrenewed.To my dismay, two of these premium domains are now listed on GoDaddy’s Afternic for substantial amounts ($5,988 and $7,880). Initially, GoDaddy attributed this issue to a billing error. However, upon consulting with PayPal, I confirmed that there were no unsuccessful payment attempts from GoDaddy. Furthermore, my PayPal account is set up with a backup payment method to ensure all charges are processed.Upon escalating this issue to GoDaddy's Level 2 support, I was informed of a "glitch" in their system that caused the failure in sending email notifications and another "glitch" preventing the billing of the eight domains. I am now being asked to repurchase my own domains at a premium price. This situation is unacceptable and has seriously eroded my trust in GoDaddy. I simply want my domains returned to me without the unfair burden of a premium price.

Review.Titre: Cannot get the domain moved to another…
Review.Contenu: Cannot get the domain moved to another registrar. Stay away from godaddy domainsGodaddy makes it intentionally extremely hard to move away domains from them. After contacting support and going through the many necessary steps, support needs to open a ticket, at their discretion, which then perhaps will generate the neede dauthorization code. Conclusion: if you buy a domain with godaddy you need to be prepared to pay their fees forever or lose the domain. I recommed stay away from godaddy domains

Review.Titre: My websites were constantly down the 8…
Review.Contenu: My websites were constantly down the 8 months I was with Godaddy.com. I spoke with customer support more in the 8 months I was with them, than I did my last hosting server in 3 years. Godaddy is a big bait and switch company!! Right on there homepage it says, "Website a penny for the first year." Then they sale you a 3 year plan, and I ended up having to pay $467 to activate the service. Because my website continued to say, "503 service error." Godaddy then said I needed to pay $80 for their techs to clean my site for good and I will not have any more problems with potential hacks or viruses. A few weeks later, here I am on back on the phone with godaddy, now they're saying that my included SSL Certificate does not keep my website safe from hackers and I need to purchase an additional firewall for $480 PER YEAR. That means I will pay an additional $1,440 over the next 3 years to continue my $467 package. That is the biggest bait and switch I have ever seen in my life! Literally 3 times the original agreement. Not to mention, what happened to the penny ad on their homepage??!! The supervisor then confirmed that the free SSL Certificate that was suppose to protecting the websites, were not on at least one of the websites. They would not give me a refund for my purchases and am needing a new server provider.

Review.Titre: Overcharging Non-Profits - 2+ Hours With Support - GoDaddy Doesn't Care About Small Businesses!
Review.Contenu: I do probono work with a highly reputable non-profit that was oversold services by GoDaddy when they built their site just over 3 years ago. To give some context, this small non-profit was sold a $600 3 year SSL plan (that is actually for up to 5 sites not just 1) that technically just renewed 3 days ago but she renewed it early more than 30 days ago. By paying for the renewal early, they say we are outside our window to actually move her to a smaller SSL plan that is for only 1 website. They also sold her on 2 other ala carte services and needless to say, it's just bad business. Now that I am helping her, I spent over an hour with support yesterday and then another hour today trying to find a way to fix this so she is getting the correct services long term and asked to shift her over to a managed Wordpress plan and then credit her for what she just renewed and apply it to that better plan. After going back and forth, they refuse to make this right. And for a non-profit that is all about improving mental health. It just makes me sick. I am now working on a plan to move all my clients and all my digital assets away from GoDaddy because of this. I asked them if it was worth losing a growing digital marketing agency over helping to fix this account and they just went back that it's their policy. Very very disappointed and disappointed that as a local Phoenix business (and they are based here) - that they are so cut and dry. I know policies are important but we weren't asking for money back but a credit to swap services. You'd think they see value in having a client long term with the right services for their business. But looks like they don't "actually care about small businesses / non-profits".

Review.Titre: GoDaddy was once a great American…

Don't be fooled, this is not your "GoDaddy" of years past that hired talented Americans that understand the nature of American business.  They locked down our company domain for weeks for claims of "mystery content" that they know was not ours, knowing full well it was harmless and something that happens to their own domain. They could care less about your business.

Review.Titre: Recent security updates mean it is…
Review.Contenu: Recent security updates mean it is virtually impossible to update the DNS on your domain name. Every single change requires a brand new pin. They purposely add their own records so that the domain goes to their own webpage, you need to delete these records & then add your own but it requires a pin number every single time. So it simply becomes an absolute pain and waste of time. If you are a web developer and need to do this various times a day on behalf of customers it literally becomes a nightmare. Avoid, plenty of other registrars out there.

Customer support then insists you try in an incognito account.Then they insist that you remove any payment methods associated with the account and wait a further 24 hours.That doesn't work either. And it takes like an hour+ just to get to this point in the conversation each time.It's a totally vile way of doing business. I'll never use them again.EDIT: As you can see below, the helpful person from GoDaddy has just told me to follow their online instructions. Which I've done! I've also contacted them! Three times! Totally poor customer experience.

Review.Titre: STAY AWAY FROM GODADDY
Review.Contenu: STAY AWAY FROM GODADDY   We are an established business that has 3 warehouses across the country, BBB accredited, been in business for almost 10 years, with a staff of 30 + people.    Recently we decided to create a website on godaddy to sell our products to retails customers.    On September 2023, We received an order for $700 + that we fulfilled the very next day. The payment of $700+ was stuck on godaddy account and they didn’t want to release it for some reason. They wanted some proofs. I have called them and emailed them dozens of times. Been on the phone for hours. Nobody at godaddy helps with anything. They keep opening these “support tickets” but they give 0 results.    Now it is December 2023, I am checking our account and finding out that the $700+ amount is gone from the godaddy system. There are no traces of this transaction anywhere. I don’t know what to think about it. Be careful with this godaddy.

Review.Titre: Warning Against GoDaddy's Price Manipulation and Broker Service Scams
Review.Contenu: If you're in search of an available domain name, be cautious when using Godaddy. Initially, they display the desired domain at a seemingly reasonable price of $11.99 per year. However, as you progress through the checkout process, they go behind you, block the domain, and change its status to 'already taken.' While this might lead you to believe another customer snatched it up, Godaddy conveniently offers a broker service for $69 to secure the same domain for you.Upon purchasing this service, a twist unfolds. Godaddy returns with a surprising message, claiming they made extensive efforts but can only secure the domain for a whopping $500. It's easy to be deceived if you don't scrutinize the details carefully. Having declined this new offer, I discovered, just a few days later, a Godaddy advertisement in the exact domain I was seeking, now conveniently parked by Godaddy themselves.This experience reveals Godaddy's questionable tactics, engaging in a dubious double game and attempting to manipulate customers into paying $500 when the initial cost was meant to be a straightforward $11.99

How does having a higher sale entitle them to withhold my money for an entire quarter of the year? Egregious, unethical practice. Avoid GoDaddy payment services at all costs or pay the price yourself! They boast low fees for credit card processing, but that’s not helpful when they decide on a whim to hold your customer’s payment to you!

I complained about a serious data breach on their side (my emails and phone numbers were literally given out!) never got a response or even an acknowledgement. Too big to care. Went to a local UK based firm - wow what a difference. Stick to local small family businesses.

Review.Titre: Sales team lie to upsell you products they dont know anything about for commision. Customer Service agents are very rude, talk over you incapable of having calm collective communications on phone.
Review.Contenu: I have managed hosting package given to me after one of the employees messed up trying to make his commission of up-selling a product that wasn't what he said it was and causing me to lose out on a lot of money and launch of my business.i was given for the equivalent of the £600 i lost out on a package until 2026.... it was a resolution i had to bit my tongue with and accept because that was the best they could do, however it meant nothing in the end because i lost the launch of my business and things fell apart due to this. so i have taken up a new venture and tried to take advantage of the "managed wordpress" that i was given till 2026. but this more expensive option (because it has extra support and security than i do not need) which ultimately limits what i can do with the hosting to nearly nothing other than create a basic website with no functions such as business email, its just a package for inexperienced users to go for with extra payment walls for any other services, an its moe expensive than normal hosting on its own.I have simply asked them to swap this package for a cheaper package and they will not provide. probably because they know this more expensive option also limits certain features forcing you to pay extra monthly to godaddy...so to be clear they gave me a "resolution" after losing me thousands of pounds in contracts due to their mistake. and then their "resolution" i can't even make use of later on is worthless and they are keeping this on my account rather than swapping it out for the MUCH CHEAPER option on their side.Sounds like they are just being difficult for no reason, again when ringing customer service i have to ask them to calm down because they are once again getting rude and losing their cool and talking over me whilst i am speaking to them calm and collectively.5 months ago i rang and they said on the phone they could 100% make this change on the phone and was confirmed. i waited for a call back she said it was late and she was finishing work. i never got a call back. At least i knew for when  i needed it i could make this change and make use of what i have here. Now i fell like its just a gamble when i call up with who actually wants to help me or who is in a bad mood and can't be bothered to help.

Review.Titre: GoDaddy Data Centre is down from last 18 hours and they do not know what to do.
Review.Contenu: I have been using their VPS for the last 4 years, and whenever downtime occurs they take 3-4 hours to fix it, But this time it's more than 18 hours now and I keep calling their customer service to get to know the details but they are responding by saying it is a natural disaster occurs and their network team is on it. But they do not know the problem and time. Being a Godaddy customer I do not have the right to get to know when my services will be back. Because they do not know. I will stop using their services from now on.

Review.Titre: MAC OS user
Review.Contenu: MAC OS user. Ever since GoDaddy moved to MS 365 for mail there have been issues, but recently they are occuring more often and affecting our business. The website help is just not very helpful. I have a fair bit of experience and computer language skills (NOT a pro, but I believe well above average user). This has been a frustrating experience to say the least.

Review.Titre: Their "short" surveys are not short and…
Review.Contenu: Their "short" surveys are not short and look for more detail with every answer.  I am leaving GoDaddy for another company that is not so intrusive.

Review.Titre: I have used GoDaddy for almost five…
Review.Contenu: I have used GoDaddy for almost five years now. As long as I had the SmartLine App, my 800 number worked great. A couple months ago they decide to go with a new app, Conversations. It sucks! It’s ruining my business. All my calls are either dropped or they can’t hear one word I’m saying from all the static on the line. I’ve called numerous times to complain and try to get an answer, but after being on hold for a short while, I get disconnected! I cannot endorse Go Daddy for conducting this type of business.

Review.Titre: Avoid!!! Continious unauthorised debits.
Review.Contenu: Twice I was billed without authorising any of the payments. I had to cancel my PayPal to stop godaddy from  continoously taking money from my account and still they managed to take almost £300 from my credit card unauthorised. Now I have cancelled my my products including my domain name to prevent been bankrupt by godaddy. All the money spent and taken from me all for nothing as I will have to start again from scratch from a different provider. This is both shameful and painful and I hope the bank is able to help me get my money from you guys.

Review.Titre: Poor customer service support still.

All of my notes should tell you what has gone wrong but again wasting my time.Hold music suggests that go daddy exceeds your expectations when its the opposite.Very poor

Review.Titre: They’ll take your money, even if they don’t provide you with any services whatsoever. Unethical in my view!
Review.Contenu: To be fair to godaddy, I didn’t have any problems setting up or using my website. Until it came to renewing my URL, which expired and led to an ask for additional subscription, which I didn’t want to pay. However, I did en up paying £244 for a service that I never received. Apparently godaddy don’t care about that and are happy to take peoples money and then not provide a service. If and when I need a website again, I won’t go back…

Review.Titre: I am so disapointed with GoDaddy
Review.Contenu: I am so disapointed with GoDaddy! I've been a customer with this company for six years now. The service is terrible now. No one wants to work or help solve any issues. I have had enough!!I'm going to terminate my account with GoDaddy and join Shopify!

Review.Titre: Terrible Customer service
Review.Contenu: "guides" never followed up on promised actions, company never sent promised information or links, Quality Control never answered questions or kept their word.   was promised resolution in hour, then in 3-4 hours,  then guaranteed within 24 hours - none off the time frames were met.  Then when finally got thru to a person who knew what to do he informed us that our window had expired and we could no longer take any action. That was almost 3 weeks ago.  His response was the same as all the others promises and comittments the company made - that is to say nonexistent.  Never heard from him/her.  Crickets. Nothing.My opinion is even more set in stone.  Stay away from this company unless you anticipate never having to use customer support.

Review.Titre: Russian clients must be punished for their origin
Review.Contenu: I occasionally found a notification from GoDaddy in my long-forgotten mailbox that, according to their records, my home address appears to be in Russian Federation. And since nowadays everyone must punish Russians for being Russians, they are cancelling my account.The message was dry and unapologetic.However, I completely understand. This must be a lawful demand, and the company has acted accordingly. We all know that such abominable social phenomena as slavery, racial segregation,  discrimination or prejudice based on origin (religion, form and shape of the head, etc) have long gone.

Review.Titre: Horrendous customer support both…
Review.Contenu: Horrendous customer support both technical and billing.Failure to let me know about changes to my account and I had to upgrade by £88.Then the product didnt work and took 3 days to sort out.Failed call backs both from tech support and supervisors 5.5 hours I have wasted with this company.I called up asking why I havent had a supervisor call which was promised within 48 hours5 days later, no call and spent 30 mins waiting on hold for a supervisor to speak to me and nothing!Dont use Go Daddy if you want a supportive supplier for your business.

Review.Titre: Do not trust this company...
Review.Contenu: Do not trust this company...As soon as you purchase a domain they then take all the domains associated with that name, so that when you come back to buy them they can sell them to you at an extortionate price. They're basically exploiting their own customers. I'm sure its what all of these sorts of companies do but it feels nasty. You'd think they might try to help you but they see an opportunity to exploit. If you are going to buy a domain name make sure you know exactly what you need and if necessary buy out all of them at the same time and go for the .com domain first otherwise they take you from behind.  When I first purchased the domain name I looked at all the options e.g. .co.uk and .com and I wrote the list of prices down, a few days later when I come to get the next one - the price has rocketed and guess who the happy owners of this domain are!!!

Review.Titre: Error from GoDaddy side not getting…
Review.Contenu: Error from GoDaddy side not getting resolved. We have shared server for our website and it has been 24 hours but the error which is from GoDaddy side is not getting resolved. They don't give proper replies but just a standard reply that it will get resolved soon. But what about the loss we are occurring as our complete E commerce website is not working.

Review.Titre: DO NOT set up your e-mail through GoDaddy! RUN!!!
Review.Contenu: Gee, GoDaddy, thank you for sabotaging our company e-mail TWICE with "Proofpoint Essentials," a would-be safety service that unilaterally classifies EVERY SINGLE MESSAGE as spam and refuses to deliver it. We did not request this "service"! In fact, we jumped through your flaming hoops once already to remove this from our e-mail accounts—at a considerable cost—and as of this morning, this misbegotten would-be ransomware is baa-aaack!Imagine that someone stood in front of your home's mailbox 24 hours a day and mugged the mail carrier every time they tried to deliver your mail. "Oh, no, you can't deliver that," the mugger rants."Pray tell why not?" replies the mail carrier."Yes, do please answer that one," I chime in."Because…because I said so! I don't care what's in that envelope or package. I say it's spam, so you can't have it!"Never mind that some envelopes contain critical questions from customers who depend on me to guide them through a software onboarding process.Never mind that other envelopes contain equally important messages from colleagues.It's all spam—because Proofpoint says it is.And if you want to get rid of Proofpoint? Be prepared to pay once again for all your company's e-mail addresses on the spot, and for anyone who manages their e-mail in Outlook to lose valuable messages. That charge to reconnect or reaffirm all those e-mail addresses is like paying ransom on top of all the other indignities involved.It took the head of our company HOURS on the phone with GoDaddy "support" to be told that we had to repurchase our entire roster of e-mail addresses—and that's a completely unsatisfactory outcome. They could not fix the problem, only compound it. I don't care that someone above their pay grade refunded the charge the next day. We lost tens of thousands of dollars of worktime value to a useless, meaningless "service" that WE NEVER REQUESTED.If you value your time, your peace of mind, and your e-mail, DON'T USE GODADDY for your e-mail provider.And I can't even use my company e-mail address to submit this review because Proofpoint is blocking all my e-mail and Trustpilot needs a 2FA code they sent to that address. [facepalm]

Review.Titre: When I first encountered GoDaddy they…
Review.Contenu: When I first encountered GoDaddy they were great. I cancelled my service with them 3 years ago, luckily my payment method had expired as they tried to automatically renew two years hence. I called the customer service team - not interested.They used to be excellent.Now - not so good.

Review.Titre: Unethical Business Practices and…
Review.Contenu: Unethical Business Practices and Customer ExploitationI recently had a deeply troubling experience with GoDaddy, a company that claims to provide domain and hosting services. Unfortunately, my encounter revealed a darker side to their operations – a blatant disregard for customer trust and outright theft.Despite the promises of transparency and fair dealings, GoDaddy has engaged in what can only be described as stealing from its users. I discovered unauthorized charges on my account, cleverly disguised under vague terms and hidden in the fine print. It's disheartening to see a company resorting to such underhanded tactics to bolster its profits.Customer service, or lack thereof, only compounded my frustration. Attempts to resolve the issue were met with indifference and a dismissive attitude. It's clear that GoDaddy prioritizes its bottom line over the well-being of its customers, leaving them feeling betrayed and taken advantage of.In an era where trust is paramount in online transactions, GoDaddy's actions are not only unethical but also damaging to its reputation. I strongly caution anyone considering their services to think twice before entrusting their business or personal endeavors to a company that resorts to stealing from its own users.

Review.Titre: Been a customer for 7 years with 5-7…
Review.Contenu: Been a customer for 7 years with 5-7 email accounts and discovered today that I was not benefitting from the online Office 365 apps.  Having just renewed some accounts for 3 years, I'm now told that there is no way for me to go back to the lower plan and no one can make exceptions.  That I find hard to believe so made up my mind that I will move off as soon as majority of my email accounts are due.  BTW, some of the 5* reviews look manufactured!

Review.Titre: Emails purchased in the Godaddy site
Review.Contenu: Emails purchased in the Godaddy site, support says I purchased the wrong ones, even thought I know I did it right, had to cancel and purchase for extra money, this is becoming a rip off, if I didn't have my sites here I'll move somewhere else.

Review.Titre: GoDaddy .NET Prank
Review.Contenu: I don't understand why a company as big as Godaddy doesn't pay attention to quality control, resulting in bugs or errors occurring in one of its services.As a new customer, I am disappointed with the problem of .NET domain registration (3/12/20023) which was canceled unilaterally, citing bugs/errors on their side and not the consumer's fault.There is no public apology on their website. just a notification via email, that my .NET domain registration was canceled (this also happened to all customers who registered that day).

Review.Titre: Can not be trusted for new top level…
Review.Contenu: Can not be trusted for new top level domains. Purchased .ing domains only to receive an email after the domains got released to say there had been an error and that I will be refunded.

Review.Titre: GoDaddy held my funds and shut down my…
Review.Contenu: GoDaddy held my funds and shut down my account. Their customer service department has no idea what they are doing. This severely affected my business, family and operation. DO NOT trust Go Daddy payments if you have a growing successful business.

Review.Titre: I'm actually planning on leaving…
Review.Contenu: I'm actually planning on leaving GoDaddy in the next month. Honestly, it's been the worst experience of my business career. Customer service is awful and the wait times are dreadful. I've had people talk down to me (who runs a business…)? it's not user-friendly... we're switching to Shopify at the end of the year. It's so much easier to use. Review.Titre: Upon domain renewal godaddy wipes the DNS record of the domain
Review.Contenu: Upon domain renewal, Godaddy wipes the DNS record of the domain. There are a number of records of this bug online, but godaddy does nothing to fix it, causing websites and email not to be accessible.Due to their terrible customer service that they don't know what to do and give wrong advice, our services were down for nearly 40 hours.I spoke 5 times on chats with Godaddy for around 8 hours total, called them another 5-6 times for around 4 hours total, and still it took 40 hours to solve the issue. Godaddy admitted to me that other Godaddy support to whom I talked to, lied to me, and gave me wrong information.We're writing a formal complaint, and gonna take it as far as we can.Godaddy supported lies, gave wrong advice that resulted in 40 lack of access to our platform & services, they don't admit their mistakes.And the worst thing is that in the last call they admitted that they have a Tech team and they could reach out to them any time to change the nameservers or DNS records back as it was.Liers, incompetent support and lies again. 12 hours talking to the support & each of their support team tell a different thing.I wish I'd never buy any services with them.1 start is too much!!!

Review.Titre: Godaddy used to offer top notch…
Review.Contenu: Godaddy used to offer top notch customer service, but not anymore. Now there support is done in a third rate fashion in third world countries.The recent problem is a double billing error on Godaddy's. After two phone calls to their billing support with them admitting to have caused the error, they took no ownership on resolving the issue, telling me I would have to resolve it through my bank on my own. Review.Titre: Definite Scam company now...
Review.Contenu: Definite Scam company now...On 11/11/2023 I bought a domain with .co extension. It was an appealing and brandable name. After buying the domian I pointed that domain to my shopify store. Due to some uncertain reasons I wasn't able to complete my store. But today 11/28/2023 when I tried to access my site, I wasn't able to access my admin panel. Upon investigating i found that on 11/27/2023 Godaddy have cancelled the domain from my account and put it up for an auctions. Stay away.....

Review.Titre: jacking around the customer
Review.Contenu: I contacted G/D and spoke to someone who was very helpful about buying a domain from a 3rd party which made me a little nervous but was assured the party had the right to sell the name and G/D would attach it to my site,, perfect. Then jack shipp emailed me saying he was finalizing the transaction and would see if the agreed on price was still available, what? The deal was done, all he had to do was connect the dots. I sent him prove and later he said he couldn't see the text. I sent prove again and asked if he could see it this time? At this point the transaction time had expired and I'd rather drop it than deal with a Jack ship again. He said that made him happy so now I want to be happy and write this review. G/D you should monitor this guy because if you don't then you don't know jack ship.

Review.Titre: GoDaddy have the plummeted in terms of…

Go elsewhere.

Review.Titre: The worst customer service in the…

No one from godaddy is willing to help. I will be moving my accounts from them as soon as possible. I don't like being lied to!Update: The terrible customer service continues! We figured out what godaddy did wrong, told their representative and they refuse to Act!Maybe change the company name to "Gonedaddy?"Don't do business with them!

Review.Titre: Websites down
Review.Contenu: Websites down often, terrible wait times. When you do get someone they can't help. Wasted hours

I asked to be transferred to a supervisor and then was sent back to the very start! I wasn’t angry when I contacted them but I sure as hell am now!

Review.Titre: They gave me different answers to my…
Review.Contenu: They gave me different answers to my simple technical question 3 times all to avoid helping me and to make them in control. They erased my files before the date they expired. They told me they would retrieve my files and never did.

Review.Titre: Really bad customer service in my…
Review.Contenu: Really bad customer service in my personal experience.I have an issue with my Microsoft e-mail since May 2023 and they can't still fix it or help me.They contradicted themselves at every phone call I have had with them.

Review.Contenu: Agent was from India, hardly spoke English . he could not understand me and could not figure how to help me. Then he hung up on me. I finally figured it out myself.

Review.Titre: No Customer Service
Review.Contenu: I can't get any customer service.  Long waits, people who can't understand English, agents who don't understand my problem (email).  Can anyone help a long time customer?  I've been trying for hours.

Review.Titre: DO not use godaddy!
Review.Contenu: Disclaimer, I have been using godaddy for over 3 years now for their web hosting and domains.The biggest gripe i have with godaddy is the lack of technical support. A small task such as setting up the website security SSL took over 4 months, and they were still unable to fix it. This was a product purchased directly from godaddy. They then later said it was seperate from the SSL certificate required to get HTTPS for your website. It wasnt. Just, poorly informed and poor technical staff, and potentially trying to get you to spend more money.Recently, my godaddy account experienced a security breach, whereby a random hacker was able to log in to my account, delete my primiary user name and change my password, all without notifying me at all. (i have done a full sweep of my security devices and no malware present). furthemore, this was right after we changed our password 2 days before.Attempting to recover the account was another nightmare. Horrible customer service who give very scripted replies, saying they understand, but really...they have no freaking clue! the account recovery team which was suppose to be available 24/7 only responded once at day. Despite the fact that I have made it blatantly clear this was a major security issues that would affect all 3 of my businesses. They really didnt give a damn.The last straw, i recieved a reply from the account recovery team, 6 hours after my last message providing verification documents (just 2 mins after recieving their email response). The told me the request to disable my two-factor verification is successful. Now why would someone who just had their account hack, be trying to remove their 2 factor verification. literally, the last method of protecting his account? Godaddy logic is guess. They ended off with it seems like you have gotten your account back. feel free to contact them for any further queries.Now this is despite multiple calls, whatsapp messages and emails requesting for them to disable the account preventing the hacker from taking any more action.

Review.Titre: I FELT LIKE I WAS SCAMMED
Review.Contenu: I am very disappointed because I was interested in a domain and called them to ask if I could pay for it in installments. They said they couldn't do that but could offer us a discount and ask for a better price. We waited happily for a reply, but INSTEAD, they increased the price of the domain by 1000 euros. I felt like I was scammed. I will never call them again.

Review.Titre: Worst ever company for customer…
Review.Contenu: Worst ever company for customer service!No response to my complaint (even from the CEO) regarding difficulties with your website and my downgraded hosting account. Security breach on my account ignored. Nothing resolved or even looked into. Appalling way to treat your customers!!**Update - grateful for GoDaddy responding. How do I get in touch via TrustPilot?***2nd update - still waiting. Why did I think your service would be better this time?!?!

Review.Titre: terrible service from Godaddy
Review.Contenu: terrible service from Godaddy, they unilaterally canceled my domain purchase, but the money was not returned, it was useless to contact customer service because there was no action, I repeatedly contacted customer service only to be told to wait, it's been 14 days my funds have not been returned, GoDaddy stole my money

Review.Titre: Dreadful experience. Avoid these guys.
Review.Contenu: Dreadful Service. Avoid at all costs. My WP website backend has been crashing without end. Cant update plugins for days on end. Still no solution. I call the help desk today and wait online with hold music for 10 mins, and the call handler cuts me off. Go Daddy used to be very good. Its now a tenth rate service. Avoid them at all costs. Pay more and go elsewhere.

Review.Titre: Works ok until it doesn't
Review.Contenu: We have been using GoDaddy for several hundred domains for the past several years and have had a number of stupid issues over that time. Today, out of the blue, our login stopped working. Their system suddenly cannot send the 2FA code to my phone. I was told through support that my ticket has been escalated and that hopefully I will be able to login sometime in the next 24 to 72 hours?! The other 2FA number we have is for my boss. Who is out of the country. Not provisioning that new email server today I guess. Disappointed that GD does not have a more modern system to allow me to at least get logged in (modern websites use a simple mechanism called a "one time code" to prevent this very issue) while they figure out the issue. I'm rating 1 star because I can't believe that the infrastructure is so bad that one day you can't log in and there is nothing meaningful they can do about it. The only benefit from this experience is that my boss finally gave me permission to move all of our domains to a more capable and responsive hosting company. Assuming I am even able to log in at some point in the next 24 to 72 hours. Very frustrating.

Review.Titre: Unhelpful support, and only over phone (no email or live chat)
Review.Contenu: I bought a domain through them and tried to forward it to an existing one. It didn't work.There's no option to get support via email or chat, so you have to call them, and it takes ages.They escalated my case to "advanced support", who sent me an unhelpful response via email. I tried replying to the email and was told to call them again.Wish I hadn't given my money to a company that treats customers this way.P.S. The live chat option on their website doesn't work (I tried two or three different browsers on two different computers).My support request is ATS-268250 — they're welcome to get in touch via email, since I've got no option to do it myself.

Review.Titre: Be VERY CAREFUL
Review.Contenu: These people are out to get every penny they can. They are flim flam talkers and could confuse Albert Einstein with their crazy talk! Be very careful when you deal with them!

Review.Titre: Okay'ish when it comes to services and…
Review.Contenu: Okay'ish when it comes to services and options, but as soon as something is just a little off, and you need support, things are just unacceptable.I had an issue with email: Basically Godaddy claimed, they could help move my email from old setup to Godaddy setup. They could not even if that was their claim in the purchase process. I asked for a refund on the purchase of premium mail, and only after 5 attempts, they did cancel 'renewal' - they did NOT refund the purchase on false promises.

Review.Titre: Refund request not processed until I called a third time
Review.Contenu: I had two refund requests one for a domain broker service which did not go through and an order for domain refund and email subscription. I was told the refund request for the latter would be processed within a week and was given a refund request number. Two weeks later I had not received the refunds for either order. I contacted GoDaddy via their chat service and was shuttled from one agent to another. While they were helpful, the chat times were long, punctuated with repeated requests for account validation and numbers to call. One agent I spoke with on the phone (where I was put on long holds) informed me that the refund requests had been processed and that I would receive email confirmations within a few hours. By EOB I had not received any emails. The last time I contacted them I was yet again made to contact several agents where I finally received part of the refund, one of which was incorrectly made out to store credit. A final call put things right and I received the refund requests. When i spoke with a supervisor i was informed the reason for the delay might be due to the amount and that they did not know why they weren't originally processed. There was too much time wasted and a process that should have been efficient (within policy and confirmed repeatedly) need not have gone through so many iterations. I’ve given the review 2 stars because the agents were responsive and I think the issue is an internal one. So double check your refund requests from GoDaddy!

Review.Titre: My husband passed away 3 years ago
Review.Contenu: My husband passed away 3 years ago. Despite multiple attempts to change contact info, get info, transfer accounts to my name, GoDaddy did nothing helpful. This resulted in the lost of two valuable domains, one of which was sold for $10K or more. The second was released and sold AFTER I had called in again and was able to change my email. Was never notified until it was too late. GoDaddy made a lot of money after my husband paid for these domains for decades. This is wrong.... especially since i have been in touch

Review.Titre: I've been frustrated recently with the…
Review.Contenu: I've been frustrated recently with the AI chatbot system.  It's never, ever helped me with a problem; a real waste of time, and it's much more difficult now to find the telephone number to call in.  I'm not liking it.  At all.

Review.Titre: Reps-even the tech support reps-are very sales-oriented
Review.Contenu: Before, I couldn't recommend GoDaddy enough. (I have managed 5 GoDaddy accounts for small businesses for over 20 years). The techs were world class and made you feel like helping the customer was top priority. But in recent years, it's very sales oriented. While you'll still get a stellar rep occasionally, it's usually hard to get sincere, dedicated tech support from the front line customer support techs. The conversation is almost continually being routed toward trying to make a sale-regardless of the problem you're needing help with. I don't blame them though-it's a company thing. Perhaps going public wasn't good for GoDaddy?

Review.Titre: Sales reps disguised as Customer Service reps...
Review.Contenu: It appears that Godaddy sales reps are disguising themselves as customer service reps to take advantage of unsuspecting customers! Everytime I call Godaddy for a service issue, they try to sell me a new product, whether I need it or not! I am aware that "customer service reps" make a commission for each product they sell if you call with a product or service related problem, so there is a financial incentive for their recommendation. That is a conflict of interest in my opinion. Customer service reps have a profit motive with each call.  For example, one of my sites needed a security certificate that originated at Godaddy but was being managed by WIX. I bought the security certificate only to find out since the site was managed by WIX, the certificate I purchased was worthless. Since I discovered this more than 30 days from purchasing the certificate, Godaddy refused to give me a refund and offered me a credit, after an intense conversation.I then agreed to use the credit to transfer the site back to Godaddy from WIX for web hosting only to find out that I could not transfer my site from WIX back to GoDaddy because they use two different website builders. I would have to rebuild the site from scratch at an additional cost from Godaddy. So the $215 credit for a security certificate that was to be used for hosting is a loss, even though the sales rep rep knew exactly what I was trying to do. I hope he was able to buy lunch with his commission!Recently I received a message on my desktop that MS Outlook for one of my email address linked to my national company was running out of storage and was 91% full. When I clicked the low storage notification link, it took me to MS Outlook on the web that said I was only using 29% storage for that email address. Godaddy allocates 50 GB of storage but Microsoft allocates 100 GB of email storage. I called Godaddy to find out why one said I used 91% and MS said I used 29% for the same email address.Turns out, I have two identical email addresses on the same domain (what?!). The one managed by Godaddy that is set at 50 GB was 91% full, but the second email address with MS Outlook personal account was only at 29%. One was created by Godaddy and one was apparently created by me. I asked the rep to simply switch the Godaddy managed email address to the server for the personal email address since I had an additional 50BG available for the exact same email address. The rep said she could but wanted to charge me $260+ for the "upgrade". Naturally I refused! This is their mindset. Godaddy saw another opportunity to sell me something I already owned! I have been a 15 year loyal customer but my  $215 unused credit wasn't enough!In my opinion, this is an unethical business model that is driving away customers like me to their competition. Bottom line is, I will not be registering any new domains with Godaddy. If I could move the domains I currently own, I would. Sad to see a good company go down this dead end road!

Review.Titre: Don't use GoDaddy's Email Service
Review.Contenu: I've been a Godaddy customer for about a decade and had pretty good experience with them so far. Recently I've purchased a new domain name and tried to use their email service to create custom email accounts. Unfortunately, this service is not ready for production use. They have a lot of issues with Microsoft 365. You must contact Microsoft and ask them to remove old records for you.. and Microsoft have no idea what you are talking about. It's been weeks that they are not able to resolve the issue. I'd say use Godaddy only for domain names. NEVER USE THEIR EMAIL SERVICE

Review.Titre: email / office 365
Review.Contenu: Password, login, reset and everything else.

Review.Titre: I purchased a full version of Office…
Review.Contenu: I purchased a full version of Office 365 from Godaddy to integrate my email on my laptop and not log onto the web when I wanted email. So the documentation after step 2 was wrong, costing me 2 hours of work before I could then reengage with GoDaddy. Then, there were other issues with multiprofiles. Some would have still been problems but if their documentation were correct, it would have saved me at least 2 hours. This is one of many gripes. When my 6 accounts expire, I am moving to another hosting service after about 15+ years as a Godaddy client.

Review.Titre: Website Issues Not figured out
Review.Contenu: I was having some major problems with my new website linking to Amazon. He did not seem to understand what the problem was. He made me feel small a couple times, and it felt like he wanted me to figure out the challenge versus him. Ultimately, I couldn’t access my website to see what the changes he made were because there was a refresh going on.

Review.Titre: Changed for the worse. No chat and bad phone customer service.
Review.Contenu: I have been a go daddy customer for almost 3 years. However, their service has changed for the worse. The chat feature doesn't work. Payment methods no longer update and customer service is not good. I hope it will improve but since I can't even contact anyone, I'll probably just find another service.

Review.Titre: Support processes are aweful
Review.Contenu: Support does not have a trouble ticket system, so if you have a continuing issue, you have to start all over each call.If they have a real technical issue, they do not accept ownership of the issue.  I've had calls dropped, and commitments to follow up ignored.  They just shove you out. As a result of this 'passive retaliation,'  I don't trust them and won't provide my customer #.

Review.Titre: The only reason for 2 stars and not 1…
Review.Contenu: The only reason for 2 stars and not 1 is because I actually got the services that I requested, but at the cost of what? Hours on the phone, unapproved payments that cannot be refunded, misinformation, and the list goes on and on. Honestly, don't be scammed by GoDaddy. Please go somewhere else.

Review.Titre: Service is fine, but they sell your info to anyone and everyone
Review.Contenu: I recently purchased a new domain and email solution. The transaction was easy and affordable. I had a question and the support person was great. It was easy to reach a real person to speak with. The huge negative is that in these few days since the purchase I am being bombarded with spam email, calls and texts. I don’t answer the calls and no messages are being left which is a clear sign these are shady companies. The text messages and emails are offering various services such as logo and website design, referencing my new domain name,  so I’m certain GoDaddy is the source. The messages are mostly unprofessional which is another sign that GoDaddy is selling customer information to anyone who wants it without vetting the buyers. Yesterday the calls started before 6:00 am and were so frequent I had to the ringer off by 12:00 pm.

Review.Titre: Awful, avoid
Review.Contenu: I was previously with BlueHost who were really good, however since moving to GoDaddy I have had nothing but problems. They blocked my email account for no reason and I have had nothing but issues with my email. I am a small business and I simply don´t have time to didciate to speak to Tech support twice a month. Loooking forward to the contract expiring so I can go back to my original company

Review.Titre: Worst customer service
Review.Contenu: Worst customer service and so very frustrating. If you don't manage to get someone in the UK to help, you won't get anywhere. Mind you, even the person that I managed to get hold of by chance told me that my domain transfer would be sorted 'within the next 3 days'..... it's now been a month.  How the hell do I get in touch with someone that can actually help please!!

Review.Titre: How to get personal support once you purchase the product
Review.Contenu: I can’t access the email account.  My password doesn’t work so once I was able to get into the account, I saved the page in my favourites and it is always open

Review.Titre: I had cancelled my website subscription…
Review.Contenu: I had cancelled my website subscription and they still billed me. Had difficulty talking to anyone, bots aside. Was unable to pursue further when they refused to pay be my money back as they could not find my transaction. My bank statement was not enough! I can only conclude that this company must have steady earnings from customers that just 'give up' in the end. I did. Have not got the time to haggle for my rights.

Review.Titre: Godaddy is not good for their promises.
Review.Contenu: I had my websites hosted at Media Temple and Godaddy bought them out.  They claimed that the transition would be seamless but it was not.  The migration team's work did not go smoothly and I had to pay for specialized Wordpress service people at Godaddy to make things work again as well as my web designers.  After a week of having my website down it was working.  I feel like they owe me and they fell short on my expectations for customer support.

Review.Titre: Very poor domain auction experience
Review.Contenu: I'm really disappointed with Godaddy. Trying to sell domains in their auction. I paid for a premium 7 day listing. The listing is almost over now, and yet they didn't update the domain with stats, like age, appraisal etc. (which they normally do). Secondly, I was trying to auction a domain containing a generic word. They emailed to tell me they couldn't list it, as the word was trademarked. Incredible!  A word that is generic and is contained in thousands of domain names!The most annoying thing is when you reply to their email, you don't hear back for almost a week. Email Support is extremely poor. All in all, a bad auction experience.  Next time I think I would auction my domains somewhere else

Review.Titre: I must say nobody can beat Godaddy in…
Review.Contenu: I must say nobody can beat Godaddy in domains but they are a big mess in providing hosting services, please guys don't say to your customers that "you need to upgrade your plan", if the provided storages is not enough for the normal websites then why you guys sell this package. I need my refund, this is it, my developer says, your website is heavy and the current hosting resources are not enough.

Review.Titre: Overpriced and the answer to every…
Review.Contenu: Overpriced and the answer to every email problem is to have to pay $80 per email for Outlook exchange.Every other company can get cpanel email to work fine.Cpanel emails wont connect to Outlook.  It has been a known problem for years and still unresolved.

Review.Titre: Not sure rep knew answer
Review.Contenu: GoDaddy rep was all over the place with possible problems. Seemed nervous or unsure about his recommendations. I think there were several problems and he weasn't sure exactly what would fix it

Review.Titre: Good luck setting up email on your phone and laptop...
Review.Contenu: Now that GoDaddy has outsourced email management to MS 365, it has been impossible for me to set up existing and new email accounts on a new phone and a new laptop using Microsoft's own Outlook app.  I have called GoDaddy about this more than once, and their suggestion is, "Use webmail."  I don't want to use Webmail, I prefer to use Outlook.  So my next chore in trying to get access to all my email accounts on all my devices is to try to find a customer service phone number for Microsoft and hopefully they're able to assist.  But I know that I'm paying a PREMIUM to GoDaddy on a handful of domains, two websites and a slew of emails.  And I have never had more difficulty setting up emails, which I have been handling for myself on my devices for 25 years.  Not a novice.  It's bad enough this time around I am motivated to move my business elsewhere.  Fortunately I haven't used any GoDaddy webbuilders, so my business is portable.

Review.Titre: Poor renewal alerts and ridiculously poor customer service system
Review.Contenu: They send 2 separate alerts for renewing your domain and renewing your website and they are not clearly marked as different renewals for 2 services purchased at the same time. Also the customer service agent said it didn't matter what rating I give him, unless I give a 10 for the company he would get penalized. If this is true godaddy has screwed metrics. And a customer should not be made to decipher this ridiculous system when we just want to renew our website. GoDaddy seems to have a lot of issues these days.

Review.Titre: Support and Customer Service Has Gone Downhill
Review.Contenu: I've been with godaddy since the early 2000s.  That's a long time.  I've had many domains throughout the years.  When I purchased my business domain, it included email.  I have also set up my gmail to work with my godaddy domain.  It's been years - I don't recall how I did it, but their support team helped me set it up.  Recently it stopped working - right after they migrated to MS 365.  I contacted their support.  It was a very frustrating experience trying to explain to their support people who kept telling me I don't have email.  I explained my situation in many different ways and they kept telling me that I didn't have the capability.  I tried to explain to them that i did, it just recently stopped working. Seriously I've had my business domain since 2005 and have been using gmail to send/receive email with that domain - I'm pretty sure I would know if I had the capability or not.  I asked to talk to the next tier support - they outright refused and told me that I don't have the issue that I told them I had.  I used the domain for my business and I am getting customer calls telling me my email is bouncing.  I told them this and let them know it's potentially costing me business.  I got no where and ultimately disconnected so I can try again with someone else.  Second person disconnected their chat after telling me they would look into it.  Horrible experience.  I would highly suggest working with a company that has better customer service - especially if your business depends on it.

Review.Titre: My Godaddy website has been invisible
Review.Contenu: I created a website for my art using GoDaddy's Website Builder about 8 years ago for what I thought was a reasonable price. Although it was easy to use and I was happy with the way it looked, I never got any feedback from the public. When I called GoDaddy recently to ask them how I could attract customers, they told me the least expensive way to do that through GoDaddy was a program that would cost me $500/month! I thought the amount was off by one or two decimal points. It is one thing to charge a small fee to create a website and another to charge an enormous financial burden for a website that can actually be seen by the public.

Review.Titre: Chat Sucks
Review.Contenu: I normally love the customer service with go daddy but this time they let me down. 3 days and they couldnt resolve the issue. No one called me back. The chat was most annoying cause they kept bumping me to somoen eelse who then had to re ask all the same questions.

Review.Titre: Price-Quality is not fair
Review.Contenu: will start from good pointsThey got most things you need to build the website: domain auctions, hostings, special conditions for WP, its very good.BUT! Everything very expensive, prices sometimes higher 2 times than their competitors. Godaddy website is very inconvenient, they need to work a lot on UX stuff. They hide extra expanses for domains and dont let to transfer auction domains for 2 months after you buy it, its crazy.

Review.Titre: I do hate the nickel-and-dime approach
Review.Contenu: I do hate the nickel-and-dime approach. Godaddy used to be easy to deal with, inexpensive, and cared about growth; now I feel like it's a lemonade stand, and we're the lemons. Now I'm trying to find out what happened to my email and it's been converted to a paid plan, seriously?, for email forwarding? horrible. simply horrible.

Review.Titre: Microsoft and godaddy working together to break our email
Review.Contenu: Twice since godaddy switched to microsoft our email has broken and caused us many hours to find workarounds. Godaddy listened but didn't really care, they just blamed microsoft, as if it wasn't them that chose that product and forced us to migrate.A bigger organization wouldn't have issues, but godaddy used to care about the little buisnesses.Godaddy was awesome for many years, we have been a customer and things just worked for well over a decade, but now we are slowly switching to another provider...

Review.Titre: Good customer service - although new email handed out to spammers.
Review.Contenu: Website design limits what text/font I can change.I don’t like the fact my new email address was shared with spammers. I know it’s GoDaddy because I haven’t yet given out my email information to anyone as I’m still setting up.Good otherwise. Fast customer service.

Review.Titre: I remained confused on pricing for my…
Review.Contenu: I remained confused on pricing for my Domain.  I believed my Domain was already protected, turns out only the content of my Domain is protected.  When the subject of cost for protection occurred I became confused.  I'm sure Stacey knew what she was saying, however I remained confused.  I paused the conversation, thanked her for helping, and hung up.

Review.Titre: Awful user interface
Review.Contenu: Their website's product management screens are a convoluted nightmare.  A labyrinth of choices where it’s unclear what option to select to get what you want, and no matter what you choose, you keep getting sent in circles down one rabbit hole after another, with screens that look similar to ones they’ve already shown but with different choices.  All making sIte navigation next to impossible.  Score on “user-friendly interface:” zero.

Review.Titre: Two months ago there was a problem…
Review.Contenu: Two months ago there was a problem receiving payments through GoDaddy. Several Payments were made to our Godaddy Account and funds never transferred into our account. It took nearly a month to correct this problem. Now the site automatically changed the language to Spanish even though my default language is United States English.  Godaddy has been extremely unreliable. I do not recommend this site. Unhappy Customer!!

Review.Titre: Renewal Prices are a massive rip off
Review.Contenu: Renewal Price being significantly higher than original price with less additional cost to GoDaddy, is just piracy.    It feels bad every time i renew a domain as i feel like i am getting "ripped off" (that is the nicest way i can put it)

Review.Titre: Startup consideration?
Review.Contenu: HiWe are a startup, working on a solution for plastic bags and providing a bridge to customers in Canada to support with creating a community of cloth bags. Thanks

Review.Titre: Unacceptable customer service wait time
Review.Contenu: The customer service representative was great and addressed my concerns well. However the hold time to talk to him (about one hour)!is unacceptable. Also GoDaddy had accidentally dropped one of my websites and that is not acceptable as well. The representative was able to find the Giles and make it functional again.

Review.Titre: The pages are hard to navigate &…
Review.Contenu: The pages are hard to navigate & unclear.  They have gone from user friendly to a poorly designed site & the Microsoft 365 Admin site is a nightmare to figure out. Stupid developers just can't leave well enough alone.

Review.Titre: Terrible customer experience
Review.Contenu: The service is fine for basics, but when you need to customize a little or to correct the flaws of some templates, it becomes a nightmare. Hard to reach assistance, people who keep you on the phone for hours while they try to figure out a solution even though they don't have a clue and tell you to chose another brand if you don't like it, and not even a claim filing option

Review.Titre: It's important to note that the claims…
Review.Contenu: It's important to note that the claims of 24/7 support should not be taken at face value. You'll likely end up waiting just as long for assistance. I signed up with them years ago for game hosting with a free email, but they took that away and forced me to switch to a new email, which isn't functioning. I've been trying to get help for some time now, but I'm still waiting with long wait times or disconnected support calls. To avoid frustration, I'd suggest finding a more reliable hosting service instead of Godaddy.

Review.Titre: Initially getting a website and set up…
Review.Contenu: Initially getting a website and set up is good but in reality the builder is poor! There are much better ones out there such as Squarespace and Wix for example. Godaddy is better value than most but quality is poor and set up is overtly complicated, gremlins with certain functions etc.

Review.Titre: In switching over to GoDaddy from…
Review.Contenu: In switching over to GoDaddy from another website builder, I opted to get on the monthly plan. I was belittled by the CS rep and told usually teenagers who are just playing around making a website go for the monthly plan...While I understand that it is cheaper and more cost effective as a small business owner who is currently in the throws of scaling my business, I found it rude, condescending and extremely unhelpful. I've never had this type of experience with GoDaddy before and I hope to never again. Training needs to happen ASAP!

Review.Titre: Unqualified support -
Review.Contenu: Customer service are readily available, but not at all helpful at all.I have a technical issue and support kept trying to palm me off on Google, saying it's a Google issue when clearly it's a website coding issue. Kinda regretting paying GoDaddy to build my website now.

Review.Titre: Very Nice Unable To Help
Review.Contenu: While Jasmer H was very pleasant, at the end of this call me emails are still compromised and I'm need to call again for assistance with correcting this problem.

Review.Titre: I’ve been a customer for more than a…
Review.Contenu: I’ve been a customer for more than a decade. Customer service has been good over the years. Maybe it’s the department or representative I worked with during my previous experience but service has gotten worse. My paid email wasn’t working for weeks. I waited on hold for more than an hour for the reps to resolve the issue. The only thing I hate more than paying for a non working product is wasted hours out of my day

Review.Titre: As a developer
Review.Contenu: As a developer, I've hosted and built all my clients' websites on Godaddy. Recently it seems they are trying to force customers to purchase annual plans or else you end up paying a jacked up price monthly, which is not ideal as you can't be sure your clients will keep their websites over a whole year. I will be moving all my clients over to a different platform, or risk loosing my clients if I have to increase monthly rates based on their increase. I've spent thousands over the time I've hosted with them which I will now take that money elsewhere.

Review.Titre: GoDaddy is not consumer-friendly
Review.Contenu: GoDaddy keeps raising prices, reducing services for those prices, and changing its own website, making it harder to navigate because of all its attempts to sell you more services. This makes the consumer have to call GoDaddy, usually with 10-15 minute hold times. The only good point is that you usually get to talk to an American, MOST of whom will answer your questions AFTER giving you sales pitches about other products and services. Their chat is AI, not human, and useless, and it takes even longer than waiting to get through by phone. Sadly, they are one of few Domain Registrars, so you and I are stuck with their awful methods.

Review.Titre: customer service is very good
Review.Contenu: customer service is very good.  There is nothing bad to say about this.  But the 2-month transfer restriction after purchasing a domain name from an auction is a very ridiculous practice.  I don't understand this.

Review.Titre: Buy domains/e-mails elsewhere!
Review.Contenu: I’ve been with Go Daddy for a few years.  Things were good until they updated to Microsoft 365 Office.  They change their billing dates at random, even though your bill is not due yet, so they are, in a sense, double-billing, and will bill U for weeks when there was no service.  My SENT folder has disappeared, and Tech Support does not know how to retrieve it and put it under my Inbox where it belongs.  I’ve discussed these issues with Customer Support, and their attitude is : “Sucks to be U”!  I will be finding a new domain/e-mail service.

Review.Contenu: I am sick of Go Daddy.  It may be my fault that I missed the deadline for the renewal (*UPDATE* by not five days...more like ten 🙄) of my website but this "redemption" fee to restore it is ridiculous.I have been a customer for 20 years and to be billed an extra $80.00 is ridiculous.There. I got that out of my system.*FURTHER UPDATE - I want to be clear that I was completely at fault.  I missed the deadline.  My problem was $80 "redemption" fee.  Go Daddy contacted me immediately and I appreciate that.

Review.Titre: Customer service great, product terrible

My free trial ran out, I tried to upgrade and instead of my website plan being upgraded, it created another free trial with a completely new website. 🤦🏻‍♀️ Still haven't gotten that fixed. Once this problem is solved, I will transfer all my 20 domains and hostings somewhere else.Contact me via +31636024218
