Review.Titre: Nihon
Review.Contenu: Description:Erecta 100mg Tablet is categorized as a phosphodiesterase type-5 (PDE 5) inhibitor medication primarily utilized to treat erectile dysfunction (impotence) in adult men. Additionally, it may also be prescribed to manage pulmonary arterial hypertension (high blood pressure in the lungs) in adults, enhancing exercise capacity and slowing down clinical deterioration.The mechanism of action of Erecta 100mg Tablet involves the relaxation of blood vessels in the penis, facilitating increased blood flow during sexual arousal, thereby aiding in the treatment of erectile dysfunction. Furthermore, Erecta 100mg Tablet also relaxes blood vessels in the lungs, augmenting blood supply and reducing cardiac workload, effectively treating pulmonary hypertension.It is essential to adhere to your doctor's prescribed duration for taking Erecta 100mg Tablet based on your medical condition. While some side effects like headache, nausea, dizziness, indigestion, and stomach upset may occur, they are usually mild and tend to resolve gradually without the need for medical intervention. If these side effects persist, consulting your doctor is advisable.Do not use Erecta 100mg Tablet if you are allergic to any of its components or if you are currently taking nitrate medications or riociguat, a drug used to manage pulmonary hypertension. This medication is not recommended for use in children. In case of hearing or visual impairment, consult your doctor promptly. Avoid alcohol consumption, as it can impair your ability to achieve an erection. Taking Erecta 100mg Tablet after a substantial meal may delay its onset of action, so it is recommended to take it with light meals.Safety AdvicesAlcoholDrinking alcohol is known to cause erection impairment. You are advised not to drink alcohol in extreme amounts before taking Sildenafil.PregnancySildenafil is a medicine used to treat erectile dysfunction in males.BreastfeedingSildenafil is a medicine used to treat erectile dysfunction in males.DrivingSildenafil can cause dizziness and can affect your vision. You should be careful if you need to drive.KidneyErecta 100mg Tablet should be used with caution in patients with kidney disease. Dose adjustment may be needed in such patients.LiverErecta 100mg Tablet should be used with caution in patients with liver impairment/liver disease. Dose adjustment may be needed in such patients.Uses of Erecta 100mg TabletErectile DysfunctionHow does Erecta 100mg Tablet work?A phosphodiesterase (PDE-5) inhibitor is Erecta 100. It improves blood flow to the penis in cases of erectile dysfunction by relaxing the muscles in penile blood vessels.Side Effects of Erecta 100mg TabletHeadacheFlushingDizzinessDo not take it more than once a day.Seek medical attention if the erection persists for more than 4 hours after sexual intercourse.Do not use Erecta 100mg Tablet if you have recently taken nitrates (medicines used in angina or chest pain).Do not take it if you have had a heart attack in the past 3 months, or stroke or heart failure in the past 6 months.Dosage & Administration of Erecta 100mg TabletThe recommended starting dose is 10 mg once a day, taken 60 minutes before sexual activity orally. Based on efficacy and side effects, the dose may be increased to a maximum of 20 mg or decreased to 5 mg. Once per day is the maximum recommended dosing frequency. Vardenafil is a medication that can be taken with or without food.Storage ConditionsKeep the temperature below 30°C and away from light and moisture. Keep out of children's reach.*VISIT FOR MORE INFO.>> nihonyakuten.comnihonyakuten.com

Review.Titre: Secure, competent CS, bit pricey, dashboard bit confusing, redundant
Review.Contenu: Good feeling of security and integrity. Customer service is always good and easy to talk to which says a lot. Only complaints  are website forces you to call CS if you need to edit your order, it automatically defaults to whats most expensive option even if you want to change it. Using the DNS portal and dashboard takes some playing, the  online help tutorials isn't great, seems like it sends you in circles and you end up with 2 ways (click on account left, or account top or account on screen 2 etc? what? and both bring you back to where you started  and you end up going to 3rd party sites for help.

Review.Titre: The GoDaddy Rep was knowledgeable
Review.Contenu: The GoDaddy Rep was knowledgeable, listened to the problem, resolved it quickly

Review.Titre: The website is very easy to use
Review.Contenu: The website is very easy to use, The customer service representative was great but it would have been nicer if the customer policy for canceling domain name ownership was a little longer. I only realized when the credit card bill came in that I no longer wanted certain domain names, but was locked into them as the cancellation period ended.

Review.Titre: No matter what the time of day
Review.Contenu: No matter what the time of day, or day of the week I am always able to reach a knowledgable professional. If I need assistance with my products or if I have questions on how to enhance any aspect of my service or plan; there is alway a live person to help. It takes the stress out of keeping my business communications healthy and strong.

Review.Titre: Stop transferring calls to other countries
Review.Contenu: I've been off and on with support all day. Finally at the end of the day I was connected with someone who I could understand clearly, wasn't in a noisy background and was able to actually help.  DJ knew just what help we needed and made the corrections we needed to get our site back to a proper state.  I wish GoDaddy would not send their US calls outbound however. I had a terrible time not only understanding the helpdesk, but they were in a very noisy background and the call was very broken. It made for a disappointing and annoying call when we needed help.

Review.Titre: My experience with each Go Daddy rep Francisca was warm and knowledgeable and quickly understood my situation.
Review.Contenu: My experience with each Go Daddy rep has been uniquely and reassuringly on point, I'd like to thank each and every rep for being expert in giving advice.

Review.Titre: Paient, thoughtful and helpful
Review.Contenu: Kathy was very patient and understanding and made relevant suggestions for me in my current situation. She easily understood what I wanted and helped me find the next step.

Review.Titre: Matthew was quite helpful
Review.Contenu: Matthew was quite helpful. However, he asked me to work with Cloud Flare regarding hosting my domain. Issue was on that site there was no way to talk to a human being and provide the instructions provided. I called GoDaddy back, and the technician took care of the entire process. That reduced the number of Xanax needed for the rest of my day.

Review.Titre: Customer service is good
Review.Contenu: Customer service is good.  However I would warn potential customers that the 5 day refund policy is not much time.

Review.Titre: support person was determined to help me find a solution
Review.Contenu: working with a support person who took their job seriously and was determined to make sure our conversation ended with me knowing that he had helped me determine the best email client solution that Godaddy had to offer and one that gave me just what I needed... no more.  Microsoft makes their job much more difficult than it used to be because Microsoft is all about having the most desirable email app only available through their most expensive option.  Outlook used to be available as a stand alone app on my PC or phone..... no longer.  those days are gone

Review.Titre: Outlook mail sucks but Jerome of Godaddy helped me get around it.
Review.Contenu: Godaddy has been hosting me for a decade or more and never did me any harm until they contracted with rotten paternalistic Microsoft for email.  Now they threatened to tank my email for going over a storage limit.  A patient fellow called Jerome explained my options and provided me with a cheap plan to fix the storage problem.  Thank you!!

Review.Titre: Www.
Review.Contenu: Www. GoDaddy has been a great resource to use. They have expanded their offerings beyond domains. One observation that I was disappointed with (or maybe don’t fully understand) is that when purchasing a domain, some require www. And some don’t? I recently purchased one and when typing it in noticed it needed the www. But the same domain without the www was still available for purchase… I feel there could be maybe more information on this when purchasing your domain.

Review.Titre: Customer service Rep's are most often…
Review.Contenu: Customer service Rep's are most often AWESOME! GoDaddy's product offerings however have become pricy and non-competitive. We have been moving our domains, email and Office products to other providers who are much more in-line with today's pricing. Otherwise, GoDaddy continues to provide the best phone support around.

Review.Titre: Responsive Support Reps
Review.Contenu: The service rep I spoke with was courteous and engaging, and was ready to take on the challenge and help me resolve the snags I was hitting.

Review.Titre: Courteous and helpful team
Smooth and easy to use templates
Review.Contenu: Smooth and easy to use templates. Quick hold time on customer support call. The person used English well.

Review.Titre: Service is great, subscriptions confusing
Review.Contenu: Customer service is great, billing and subscriptions are confusing. Everything seems like an upsell unfortunately. Just need a basic domain and email addresses for my business.  The service reps were great that I did talk to and helped guide me along the way. Overall would most likely use again.

Review.Titre: Customer service is great
Review.Contenu: Customer service is great. I’m disappointed in the layout for domain versus website on GoDaddy. Most people, I would assume, came to GoDaddy to create a website yet the initial home page is all about domains. For someone unaware of the difference, I assumed the website is part of the domain only to find out the hard way that both are separate and billed separately as well. Because the information isn’t very clear, I assumed the payment for the website was just for marketing, and when the card expired, I lost all of my website information. I have now lost hours of my time and effort, because I couldn’t find a good explanation of the difference between a domain and a website. I feel the information should be clarified when using Go Daddy that a domain and a website are completely separate and billed separately as well.

Review.Titre: I came from Network Solutions where…
Review.Contenu: I came from Network Solutions where they effectively shut down my website for months due to a mistake. Talking to them was like talking to a brick wall. However, when I moved to GoDaddy, it was completely different. Every time I call, I speak to a human being, who cares and does their best. They also seem to have a great sense of humor, which is really important when things get rough. Love GoDaddy love the people there.

Review.Titre: I was researching a charge to my credit…
Review.Contenu: I was researching a charge to my credit card that was mysterious - listed only as GDP*OTT - which means Go Daddy Processing of a third party online merchant - but the transaction number is meaningless to Go Daddy and there is no way to trace. It would be much more helpful to show the name of the merchant.

Go Daddy was responsible for managing my SSL certificates. They just didn’t do a very good job and doing this and as a result, my business has suffered significantly.
